title: Judges Chapter 14 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Judges chapter 14 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Judges Chapter 14 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Judges Chapter 14.

questions.question: Where did Samson go when he saw a woman of the daughters of the Philistines?
options: Timnath
Jerusalem
Bethlehem
Gaza
questions.correctAnswer: Timnath
questions.explanation: Judges 14:1 states that Samson went down to Timnath and saw a woman there.

questions.question: Who did Samson tell about the woman he saw in Timnath?
options: His father and mother
His friends
The Philistine elders
The priest
questions.correctAnswer: His father and mother
questions.explanation: Judges 14:2 tells that Samson came up and told his father and mother about the woman.

questions.question: What was Samson's parents' concern about his choice of wife?
options: She was uncircumcised and a Philistine
She was too young
She was from a faraway land
She was already married
questions.correctAnswer: She was uncircumcised and a Philistine
questions.explanation: Judges 14:3 records that his parents asked if there was no woman among their own people and mentioned the uncircumcised Philistines.

questions.question: True or False: Samson's parents knew that the LORD had planned for him to seek an occasion against the Philistines.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Judges 14:4 says that his parents did not know it was of the LORD that Samson sought an occasion against the Philistines.

questions.question: What did Samson encounter in the vineyards of Timnath?
options: A roaring young lion
A wild bear
A serpent
A flock of birds
questions.correctAnswer: A roaring young lion
questions.explanation: Judges 14:5 describes that a young lion roared against Samson in the vineyards of Timnath.

questions.question: How did Samson kill the lion?
options: With a sword
With a spear
By tearing it apart with his bare hands
With a trap
questions.correctAnswer: By tearing it apart with his bare hands
questions.explanation: Judges 14:6 says the Spirit of the LORD came mightily upon him and he rent the lion as he would a kid, with nothing in his hand.

questions.question: True or False: Samson told his parents about killing the lion.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Judges 14:6 states that Samson did not tell his father or mother what he had done.

questions.question: What did Samson find inside the carcass of the lion when he returned?
options: Honey and bees
Gold coins
A snake
Water
questions.correctAnswer: Honey and bees
questions.explanation: Judges 14:8 shows that Samson saw a swarm of bees and honey in the carcass of the lion.

questions.question: To whom did Samson give the honey he took from the lion's carcass?
options: His father and mother
His wife
The Philistine elders
His companions
questions.correctAnswer: His father and mother
questions.explanation: Judges 14:9 says Samson gave honey to his father and mother but did not tell them where it came from.

questions.question: What did Samson do when he went to the woman's house?
options: Made a feast as young men used to do
Built a house
Started a battle
Held a prayer meeting
questions.correctAnswer: Made a feast as young men used to do
questions.explanation: Judges 14:10 reports that Samson made a feast, which was the custom of young men.

questions.question: How many companions did the Philistines bring to be with Samson?
options: Thirty
Ten
Twenty
Fifty
questions.correctAnswer: Thirty
questions.explanation: Judges 14:11 states that they brought thirty companions to be with Samson.

questions.question: What did Samson propose to the companions at the feast?
options: A riddle
A wrestling match
A race
A song contest
questions.correctAnswer: A riddle
questions.explanation: Judges 14:12 tells that Samson put forth a riddle to the men at the feast.

questions.question: True or False: The men could solve Samson's riddle in three days.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Judges 14:14 states that the men could not expound the riddle in three days.

questions.question: Who did the men threaten to burn if Samson did not reveal the riddle?
options: Samson's wife and her father's house
Samson's parents
Samson's companions
The city gates
questions.correctAnswer: Samson's wife and her father's house
questions.explanation: Judges 14:15 says the men threatened Samson's wife and her father's house if she did not entice Samson to reveal the riddle.

questions.question: Complete the riddle Samson posed: 'Out of the eater came forth ______, and out of the strong came forth sweetness.'
options: meat
water
gold
wine
questions.correctAnswer: meat
questions.explanation: Judges 14:14 records Samson's riddle as 'Out of the eater came forth meat, and out of the strong came forth sweetness.'

medium.title: Judges Chapter 14 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Judges Chapter 14 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Judges 14 teach us about trusting God's sovereign plan even when we do not understand it fully?
options: Samson's parents did not know God was directing his choice of wife
Samson ignored his parents and chose his own wife
Samson prayed first before choosing his wife
Samson's parents approved because they knew God's will
questions.correctAnswer: Samson's parents did not know God was directing his choice of wife
questions.explanation: Judges 14:3-4 shows that Samson's parents questioned his choice, but they did not realize that God was using this to fulfill His purpose against the Philistines. This teaches believers to trust God's sovereign plan even when circumstances seem unclear.

questions.question: A believer faces opposition in their family for following God's leading. What biblical truth from Judges 14 encourages perseverance?
options: Samson persisted in his choice despite parental objections
Samson abandoned his plan after his parents' concerns
Samson sought approval from everyone before acting
Samson ignored God's guidance to please his parents
questions.correctAnswer: Samson persisted in his choice despite parental objections
questions.explanation: Judges 14:2-3 demonstrates that Samson followed God’s direction even though his parents disagreed, teaching us to persevere in God's leading despite family opposition.

questions.question: What does Samson’s encounter with the lion and the honey teach about God providing in unexpected ways?
options: God can bring sweetness and provision from difficult trials
Honey was Samson's reward for defeating a wild animal
Samson found honey to eat because he was hungry
The lion was a symbol of Samson’s strength
questions.correctAnswer: God can bring sweetness and provision from difficult trials
questions.explanation: Judges 14:5-9 shows how after Samson killed the lion, bees made honey in the carcass. This illustrates that God can provide blessings from challenging circumstances.

questions.question: How does Samson’s silence about the lion’s honey challenge us regarding honesty and integrity in relationships?
options: He did not tell his parents or wife about the honey
He openly shared all details with his wife
He confessed everything to his parents immediately
He told only the men at the feast about the honey
questions.correctAnswer: He did not tell his parents or wife about the honey
questions.explanation: Judges 14:6 and 14:9 explain Samson kept the honey secret, which warns us of the importance of honesty and openness to maintain trust in relationships.

questions.question: In the context of marriage and fellowship, what lesson can be drawn from the riddle Samson posed to the Philistines?
options: Communication and trust are vital to prevent betrayal
Riddles strengthen marital bonds
Keeping secrets protects the family
Marriage should avoid social interaction
questions.correctAnswer: Communication and trust are vital to prevent betrayal
questions.explanation: Judges 14:12-17 shows that Samson’s wife was pressured to reveal the riddle because he did not share it with her, highlighting the need for openness and trust in marriage.

questions.question: How does the behavior of Samson's wife and her people illustrate the dangers of succumbing to pressure and fear?
options: They threatened to burn her house if she did not reveal the riddle
They supported Samson's secrecy
They trusted Samson completely
They avoided conflict and left Samson alone
questions.correctAnswer: They threatened to burn her house if she did not reveal the riddle
questions.explanation: Judges 14:15 reveals the Philistines threatening Samson’s wife, showing how fear can lead to compromising our values and betraying trust.

questions.question: What biblical virtue regarding patience and endurance is taught through the seven days of the feast and the riddle challenge?
options: Endurance through trials is necessary even when pressured
Quick answers are always best
Avoid challenges that cause discomfort
Yield immediately to avoid conflict
questions.correctAnswer: Endurance through trials is necessary even when pressured
questions.explanation: Judges 14:14-17 describes the seven days of the feast where the riddle was pondered under pressure, teaching believers to endure temptations and trials patiently.

questions.question: How does Samson’s response to the Philistines after the riddle was revealed demonstrate godly justice and accountability?
options: He slew thirty men and reclaimed his possessions
He ignored the insult and forgave them
He fled without confrontation
He appealed to the elders for judgment
questions.correctAnswer: He slew thirty men and reclaimed his possessions
questions.explanation: Judges 14:19 shows Samson taking action to uphold his word and justice, reminding believers to act with integrity and accountability when wronged.

questions.question: What lesson about generosity and keeping promises can be learned from Samson giving garments to those who solved the riddle?
options: Keep your commitments and be generous to others
Avoid giving rewards to enemies
Promises can be ignored when upset
Only give to close friends
questions.correctAnswer: Keep your commitments and be generous to others
questions.explanation: Judges 14:12-13 and 14:19 depict Samson fulfilling his promise of gifts to those who solved the riddle, teaching faithfulness and generosity.

questions.question: How does the riddle "Out of the eater came forth meat, and out of the strong came forth sweetness" reflect spiritual truths about trials and blessings?
options: Difficult challenges can produce sweet blessings
Riddles are meant to confuse
Strength should be avoided
Sweetness always comes without effort
questions.correctAnswer: Difficult challenges can produce sweet blessings
questions.explanation: Judges 14:14 and 14:8 reveal the riddle’s meaning from the lion’s carcass with honey, illustrating how God can bring good from hardship.

questions.question: True or False: Samson's parents fully understood the spiritual purpose behind his marriage to a Philistine woman.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Judges 14:4 states that Samson's parents did not know that God was using his marriage to seek an occasion against the Philistines, showing limited human understanding of God's plans.

questions.question: True or False: Samson told his wife the riddle immediately after he posed it to the Philistine men.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Judges 14:16-17 shows that Samson did not tell his wife the riddle until she wept and pressured him for seven days, highlighting the importance of openness in relationships.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Samson said, "Out of the eater came forth _______, and out of the strong came forth _______."
options: meat and sweetness
water and honey
strength and fruit
fire and water
questions.correctAnswer: meat and sweetness
questions.explanation: Judges 14:14 records Samson’s riddle exactly as "Out of the eater came forth meat, and out of the strong came forth sweetness," symbolizing blessings from trials.

questions.question: How does the story of Samson’s wife being given to his companion after the feast warn us about faithfulness in marriage?
options: It shows the consequences of broken trust and unfaithfulness
It encourages sharing spouses for peace
It teaches that marriage is flexible
It promotes divorce when problems arise
questions.correctAnswer: It shows the consequences of broken trust and unfaithfulness
questions.explanation: Judges 14:20 reveals that Samson’s wife was given to another man, illustrating the importance of faithfulness and the potential pain when trust is broken.

questions.question: What practical counsel about dealing with temptation can be drawn from Samson’s interactions during the feast?
options: Do not withhold important truths from those close to you
Use riddles to confuse enemies
Let others solve your problems
Avoid social gatherings
questions.correctAnswer: Do not withhold important truths from those close to you
questions.explanation: Judges 14:16-17 shows Samson withholding the riddle from his wife, which led to betrayal, teaching that honesty helps resist temptation and maintain trust.

hard.title: Judges Chapter 14 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Judges Chapter 14.

questions.question: What was the primary reason Samson's parents objected to his desire to marry a Philistine woman?
options: They wanted him to marry within their own people
They disliked the woman personally
They feared the Philistines' military power
They wanted him to remain single
questions.correctAnswer: They wanted him to marry within their own people
questions.explanation: Judges 14:3 shows Samson's parents asking if there were no women among their own people for him to marry, objecting to his choice of a Philistine wife.

questions.question: How does Samson's encounter with the lion foreshadow his later battles against the Philistines?
options: It symbolizes his strength given by God to overcome enemies
It shows his fear of wild animals
It indicates his inability to protect himself
It predicts his peaceful coexistence with the Philistines
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes his strength given by God to overcome enemies
questions.explanation: Judges 14:6 describes the Spirit of the LORD coming upon Samson, enabling him to kill the lion with his bare hands, symbolizing divine empowerment for future conflicts.

questions.question: What literary device is used in Samson's riddle: 'Out of the eater came forth meat, and out of the strong came forth sweetness'?
options: Paradox
Chiasm
Alliteration
Metaphor
questions.correctAnswer: Paradox
questions.explanation: The riddle contrasts the idea of a lion (eater and strong) producing honey (meat and sweetness), which is a paradoxical image, as seen in Judges 14:14.

questions.question: In the context of Judges 14, how does the presence of the Philistines reflect the historical setting of the narrative?
options: They were the dominant power oppressing Israel at that time
They were allies of Israel
They were migrating nomads with no fixed territory
They were a peaceful trading people
questions.correctAnswer: They were the dominant power oppressing Israel at that time
questions.explanation: Judges 14:4 explicitly states that the Philistines had dominion over Israel, setting the historical context for Samson’s conflicts.

questions.question: What is the significance of Samson not revealing the source of the honey to his parents or his wife initially?
options: It indicates secrecy and foreshadows future betrayal
It shows his shame about the honey
It reflects his distrust of his family
It was a cultural custom to keep such things secret
questions.correctAnswer: It indicates secrecy and foreshadows future betrayal
questions.explanation: Judges 14:6 and 14:9 show Samson keeping the event secret, which later leads to his wife betraying him by revealing the riddle's answer.

questions.question: How does Samson's marriage to a Philistine woman serve as a narrative device in Judges?
options: It creates tension between Israel and the Philistines
It resolves the conflict between the two peoples
It highlights Samson’s diplomatic skills
It demonstrates the Philistines' submission to Israel
questions.correctAnswer: It creates tension between Israel and the Philistines
questions.explanation: Samson’s choice to marry a Philistine woman, despite parental objections, heightens the cultural and political conflict, as shown in Judges 14:1-3.

questions.question: What cultural practice is indicated by Samson making a feast for his wedding in Judges 14?
options: A customary wedding celebration among young men
A ritual sacrifice to the gods
A public announcement of betrothal
A harvest festival
questions.correctAnswer: A customary wedding celebration among young men
questions.explanation: Judges 14:10 notes that Samson made a feast, as was usual among young men, indicating a cultural wedding celebration.

questions.question: What role does the Spirit of the LORD play in Samson's actions in this chapter?
options: It empowers Samson to perform feats of strength
It causes Samson to fall asleep
It leads Samson to pray for wisdom
It condemns Samson for marrying a Philistine
questions.correctAnswer: It empowers Samson to perform feats of strength
questions.explanation: Judges 14:6 and 14:19 describe the Spirit of the LORD coming upon Samson, enabling him to kill the lion and later slay thirty Philistines.

questions.question: Which theme present in Judges 14 is also a major motif throughout the Book of Judges?
options: Conflict between Israel and surrounding nations
The establishment of monarchy
Construction of the tabernacle
Exile to Babylon
questions.correctAnswer: Conflict between Israel and surrounding nations
questions.explanation: The ongoing struggle with the Philistines in Judges 14 reflects the broader theme of Israel's battles with neighboring peoples throughout the Book of Judges.

questions.question: What does Samson’s riddle metaphorically refer to?
options: The honey from the lion’s carcass
The Philistine's wealth
A harvest of wheat
The power of Israel’s God
questions.correctAnswer: The honey from the lion’s carcass
questions.explanation: The riddle in Judges 14:14 directly references the strange event of honey found in the carcass of a lion, symbolizing hidden sweetness from a strong eater.

questions.question: What consequence did Samson's wife face after the riddle was revealed to the Philistines?
options: She was given to Samson's companion
She was banished from Timnath
She was killed by the Philistines
She became queen of the city
questions.correctAnswer: She was given to Samson's companion
questions.explanation: Judges 14:20 states that Samson’s wife was given to the man who had been his companion, showing the fallout from the riddle’s betrayal.

questions.question: True or False: Samson openly told his wife the answer to the riddle as soon as he thought of it.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Judges 14:16-17 shows Samson initially refusing to tell his wife, only revealing the answer after she persistently wept for seven days.

questions.question: How does Samson's killing of thirty men after the riddle’s answer was revealed demonstrate a typological link to other biblical judges?
options: It shows divine empowerment to defeat enemies like Gideon and Deborah
It illustrates a failure to lead Israel to peace
It reflects a punishment from God
It reveals Samson’s political ambitions
questions.correctAnswer: It shows divine empowerment to defeat enemies like Gideon and Deborah
questions.explanation: Samson’s defeat of thirty men (Judges 14:19) typifies the judges’ role as divinely empowered deliverers, similar to Gideon and Deborah.

questions.question: What is the significance of the phrase 'The Spirit of the LORD came mightily upon him' in the context of ancient Hebrew narrative?
options: It indicates divine empowerment for a specific mission
It is a poetic description of physical strength
It suggests possession by a foreign god
It refers to a ritual anointing
questions.correctAnswer: It indicates divine empowerment for a specific mission
questions.explanation: This phrase, used in Judges 14:6 and 14:19, shows God’s Spirit empowering Samson for acts that fulfill His purpose, a common narrative trope in Judges.

questions.question: What cultural or historical insight can be drawn from the Philistines threatening to burn Samson’s wife and her family if the riddle was not solved?
options: It illustrates the harshness of ancient Near Eastern legal customs
It shows a peaceful negotiation tactic
It reveals the Philistines’ respect for Samson
It indicates a misunderstanding of marriage customs
questions.correctAnswer: It illustrates the harshness of ancient Near Eastern legal customs
questions.explanation: Judges 14:15 reflects the severe social and legal consequences for breaking agreements or insults in the ancient Near East, including threats of violence.

questions.question: How does Samson's marriage and subsequent actions reflect the broader theme of Israel's struggle with idolatry and assimilation in the Old Testament?
options: It symbolizes Israel's temptation by foreign influences and God's judgment
It represents Israel’s military alliances
It depicts the embracing of Philistine religious practices
It shows Israel’s prosperity through intermarriage
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes Israel's temptation by foreign influences and God's judgment
questions.explanation: Samson marrying a Philistine woman (Judges 14:1-3) reflects Israel's ongoing struggle with assimilation and idolatry, themes central in Old Testament narratives.

theological.title: Judges Chapter 14 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Judges Chapter 14 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What motivated Samson to seek a wife among the daughters of the Philistines?
options: His personal desire and God's sovereign purpose
His parents' insistence
A political alliance with the Philistines
A command from the elders of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: His personal desire and God's sovereign purpose
questions.explanation: Judges 14:1-4 shows Samson's personal desire for a Philistine woman, yet verse 4 clarifies that this was part of God's plan to confront the Philistines. This illustrates God's sovereignty working through human desires (Proverbs 16:9, Romans 8:28, Genesis 50:20, Isaiah 10:5-7).

questions.question: How did Samson demonstrate the Spirit of the LORD's power over the lion he encountered?
options: He tore the lion apart with his bare hands
He used a sword to kill the lion
He ran away from the lion
He trapped the lion in a pit
questions.correctAnswer: He tore the lion apart with his bare hands
questions.explanation: Judges 14:5-6 records that the Spirit of the LORD came mightily upon Samson, enabling him to tear the lion as easily as a kid, showing divine empowerment for God's purposes (1 Samuel 10:6, Ezekiel 3:14, Acts 1:8, Galatians 5:22-23).

questions.question: What was unusual about the source of the honey that Samson found?
options: It was found inside the carcass of a lion
It was produced by wild bees in a tree
It was a gift from the Philistine woman
It was brought to him by an angel
questions.correctAnswer: It was found inside the carcass of a lion
questions.explanation: Judges 14:8 describes the miraculous presence of bees and honey inside the lion's carcass, symbolizing sweetness arising from strength and death, pointing to God's providence and the paradox of blessing in unusual circumstances (Isaiah 7:15, Matthew 3:4, John 3:27, Romans 5:17).

questions.question: What was the content of the riddle Samson posed at his wedding feast?
options: "Out of the eater came forth meat, and out of the strong came forth sweetness"
"Who can find honey in the lion's mouth?"
"What is stronger than a lion and sweeter than honey?"
"A man who conquers his enemies is blessed"
questions.correctAnswer: "Out of the eater came forth meat, and out of the strong came forth sweetness"
questions.explanation: Judges 14:14 presents the riddle explicitly, which encapsulates the paradox of life and sweetness coming from death and strength, a theme resonating with God's use of weakness to display His power (2 Corinthians 12:9, Isaiah 40:29, Psalm 23:4, Hebrews 12:11).

questions.question: Why did Samson's wife weep before him during the feast?
options: To persuade him to reveal the riddle to the Philistines
Because she was mourning her family
Because she was afraid of the feast's danger
Because she wanted to leave the feast early
questions.correctAnswer: To persuade him to reveal the riddle to the Philistines
questions.explanation: Judges 14:15-17 narrates how Samson's wife was pressured by the Philistines to uncover the riddle, and she wept to influence Samson to disclose its meaning. This shows human weakness and the consequences of secrecy (Proverbs 27:5, James 1:14-15, Psalm 56:8, Ecclesiastes 7:9).

questions.question: What was Samson's response when his wife asked him to tell her the riddle?
options: He refused, saying he had not told even his parents
He immediately told her the riddle
He changed the riddle to confuse her
He asked her to guess
questions.correctAnswer: He refused, saying he had not told even his parents
questions.explanation: Judges 14:16 records Samson's refusal to reveal the riddle, emphasizing his loyalty to secrecy even over his wife, highlighting tensions between personal vows and relational trust (Numbers 30:2, Matthew 5:37, Proverbs 11:13, Psalm 25:14).

questions.question: What was the outcome after Samson's wife disclosed the riddle to the Philistine companions?
options: They solved the riddle and won the wager
They failed to solve the riddle and lost the wager
They attacked Samson immediately
They abandoned the feast without solving it
questions.correctAnswer: They solved the riddle and won the wager
questions.explanation: Judges 14:17-18 recount the men solving the riddle due to the wife’s disclosure, which led to Samson's anger and violent retaliation, illustrating the consequences of betrayal and divine justice (Proverbs 25:9, Luke 16:10, Hebrews 10:30, Romans 12:19).

questions.question: How did Samson respond after the Philistines solved the riddle?
options: He killed thirty men and took their spoil
He fled the city immediately
He apologized and paid the wager
He renewed the riddle with a new one
questions.correctAnswer: He killed thirty men and took their spoil
questions.explanation: Judges 14:19 shows Samson empowered by the Spirit of the LORD to kill thirty Philistines and seize their garments to pay his wager, demonstrating divine strength and judgment against Israel's enemies (Judges 13:25, 1 Samuel 11:6, Acts 1:8, Psalm 18:34).

questions.question: What role does the Spirit of the LORD play in Samson's actions in this chapter?
options: Enables supernatural strength for God's purposes
Merely inspires his speeches
Leads him away from conflict
Makes him a political leader
questions.correctAnswer: Enables supernatural strength for God's purposes
questions.explanation: Verses 6 and 19 emphasize that the Spirit of the LORD empowered Samson for mighty acts, showing God's direct intervention in human history to accomplish His will (Judges 13:25, Isaiah 11:2, Luke 1:35, Acts 10:38).

questions.question: What theological theme is illustrated by Samson's choice to marry a Philistine woman?
options: God's sovereignty over human decisions for redemptive purposes
The importance of ethnic purity at all costs
Human free will independent of God's plan
Rejection of God's covenant
questions.correctAnswer: God's sovereignty over human decisions for redemptive purposes
questions.explanation: Judges 14:3-4 shows that though Samson acted on personal desire, God used this to initiate conflict with the Philistines, illustrating the doctrine of divine providence (Genesis 50:20, Romans 8:28, Exodus 9:12, Proverbs 21:1).

questions.question: What does the honey in the lion's carcass symbolize in a Christological perspective?
options: Life and sweetness emerging from death and judgment
A reward for human strength
A natural occurrence without deeper meaning
The weakness of human flesh
questions.correctAnswer: Life and sweetness emerging from death and judgment
questions.explanation: The honey from the dead lion (Jdg 14:8) reflects the paradox of Christ’s death bringing life and sweetness, consistent with John 12:24, Romans 6:9, Isaiah 53:5, and 1 Corinthians 15:54-57.

questions.question: How does the narrative of Samson's riddle reflect the theme of wisdom in Scripture?
options: It shows the value of discernment and revelation
It discourages sharing knowledge
It elevates human cleverness over divine wisdom
It mocks the wisdom of outsiders
questions.correctAnswer: It shows the value of discernment and revelation
questions.explanation: Samson's riddle (Jdg 14:14) and its solution illustrate the biblical theme that true wisdom comes from God and revelation, aligned with Proverbs 2:6, James 1:5, Colossians 2:3, and Ecclesiastes 7:12.

questions.question: What does the conflict between Samson and the Philistines in this chapter reveal about God's judgment on Israel's enemies?
options: God raises up deliverers empowered by the Spirit to defeat oppressors
God passively allows Israel to suffer without intervention
God favors the Philistines as a chosen people
God condemns all violence equally
questions.correctAnswer: God raises up deliverers empowered by the Spirit to defeat oppressors
questions.explanation: Samson's Spirit-empowered acts against the Philistines (Jdg 14:6,19) reveal God's active judgment and deliverance through chosen leaders, consistent with Exodus 3:10, Judges 3:9-10, 2 Samuel 22:40, and Acts 13:22.

questions.question: What ecclesiological insight can be drawn from the role of Samson’s companions at the feast?
options: Communal participation and peer pressure in covenantal events
Isolation of the individual from the community
The rejection of social gatherings in spiritual life
The absence of conflict within the community
questions.correctAnswer: Communal participation and peer pressure in covenantal events
questions.explanation: Judges 14:10-11 shows the presence of companions who engage in the feast and riddle contest, highlighting the community’s role in covenantal and social dynamics, paralleling 1 Corinthians 12:12-27, Hebrews 10:25, Acts 2:42, and Psalm 133:1.

questions.question: What does Samson giving garments to those who solved the riddle indicate about his character and covenant obligations?
options: He honored his promises despite personal anger
He refused to acknowledge the loss
He used violence instead of fulfilling his vow
He sought to punish them unjustly
questions.correctAnswer: He honored his promises despite personal anger
questions.explanation: Judges 14:19 shows Samson providing garments as agreed, illustrating the biblical principle of keeping vows even amidst conflict (Ecclesiastes 5:4-5, Numbers 30:2, Matthew 5:33-37, Psalm 15:4).

questions.question: What does the final verse about Samson's wife being given to his companion reveal about the social and relational consequences of Samson's actions?
options: Breach of trust and relational betrayal within the community
A harmonious resolution of conflict
Divine approval of all Samson’s decisions
A joyful union celebrated by all
questions.correctAnswer: Breach of trust and relational betrayal within the community
questions.explanation: Judges 14:20 indicates Samson's wife being given to another man, revealing consequences of broken trust and relational strife, consistent with biblical warnings about faithfulness and integrity (Proverbs 6:32, Malachi 2:14, Matthew 19:6, Ephesians 4:25).
